text: Iâ€™m looking to add a *UI extension* to an existing app in *HubSpot*. Can anyone guide me on how to integrate this into the app?

Hi <@U081VHNFK17>. First you need to migrate the public app to projects and then you can upload or develop a new UI extension for it. More information about the process is included in this document <https://developers.HubSpot.com/beta-docs/guides/crm/public-apps/migrate-a-public-app-to-projects>

Thanks for the response, <@U056ZR8LVJQ>.
 I've completed migrating to the project framework and uploading the project to deploy the builds. However, I'm now stuck on how to create a UI extension in that folder and what needs to be uploaded in the existing files, such as the scope and UI extension in the public-app.json file.

You should probably generate a new app to experiment with the configuration and development then. You can use the getting started template from `hs project create` to generate this locally <https://developers.HubSpot.com/beta-docs/guides/crm/public-apps/quickstart>
Is it possible to update my existing UI extension code to the migrated project framework folder and upload it to the existing public app?
yes, the UI extension code is generally portable between projects/apps if you copy the files and modify the configuration files and reupload
